msDesc.physDesc: The letter is one page long on cream colored paper with typewritten text. At the top of the first page there is an indecipherable, paranthetical word written in pencil.

body.div:
April 26, 1916</ My dear Mrs. Aldis:
You must think me fearfully rude to have apparently disappeared during your visit to Boston! As a matter of fact, I did disappear—that was just the trouble.
When your son telephoned over that you would not be able to dine with me on Sunday, I cannot tell you how disappointed I was. But, unfortunately, I went away immediately to New York, and when I got back I telephoned out to your son’s rooms and found that you and he had already gone to Chicago. I meant to write to you from New York, but I was in such a rush while I was there that I never found a moment to put pen to paper. I am sorry. I had looked forward to your visit, and it was a shame that it should have coincided with my absence.
I read an account of your plays at The Little Theatre which sounded most enthusiastic. Very sincerely yours,
